purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of general model parameters. A general model parameter is an input, output, or both, related to a model of some functionality, simulation or analysis.

inscope.li: the representation of a general model parameter
the representation of the default value of the parameter

outscope.li: relating a general model parameter to a model
the representation of the actual value of the general model parameter for input or output

usage_guide.p: Implementations of this part of ISO 10303 make use of the capability to classify an entity type using . This annex contains a subclause for each entity type defined in this part of ISO 10303 for which that capability shall be applied. The specified Uniform Resource Identifiers (URI) is used to identify each class.
UML diagrams are used to represent the classes related to the EXPRESS entity types in question. The following UML Stereotypes are utilized.

ul.li: expressEntityType applied to a UML Class denotes the EXPRESS entity type
owlClass applied to a UML Class denotes the related class
classificationAssignment applied to a UML Generalization denotes the fact that the EXPRESS entity type that is the general class can be classified using the more specific class

usage_guide.p: Additionally, the disjointWith constraint is applied where appropriate to specify the set of subclasses are mutually exclusive. This is the equivalent of the EXPRESS ONEOF concept.

guide_subclause.title: Classifications of General_model_parameter
guide_subclause.p:
A may be classified in order to specify its direction with respect to the model for which it is a parameter. For the purpose of specifying that direction, the OMG UML 2.1 concept of ParameterDirectionKind is used. The following terms represent the same concepts from the UML 2.1 specification regarding ParameterDirectionKind and are referenced using the specified URIs.
General_model_parameter Taxonomy
guide_subclause.guide_subclause:
A ParemeterDirectionKind-in indicates that parameter values are passed into the model.
URI Specification
http://schema.omg.org/spec/UML/2.1/ParemeterDirectionKind-in

A ParemeterDirectionKind-out indicates that parameter values are passed from a model.
URI Specification
http://schema.omg.org/spec/UML/2.1/ParemeterDirectionKind-out

A ParemeterDirectionKind-inout indicates that parameter values are passed into a model and then back out from the model.
URI Specification
http://schema.omg.org/spec/UML/2.1/ParemeterDirectionKind-inout

A ParemeterDirectionKind-return indicates that parameter values are passed as return values from a model.
URI Specification
http://schema.omg.org/spec/UML/2.1/ParemeterDirectionKind-return
